item.title: [APOLLOFI] Apollo Finvest India Ltd Announces Q3 and Nine Months Results for December 31, 2025
item.description:
Apollo Finvest India Ltd announced its financial results for the quarter and nine months ended December 31, 2025. The company's profit before tax stands at INR 15.77 crores, and the profit after tax is INR 16.54 crores. The earnings per equity share (of 210 each) are INR 4.91 (basic) and INR 4.67 (diluted). The results have been reviewed by the Audit Committee and approved by the Board of Directors.

  • Profit before tax for the quarter is INR 15.77 crores.
  • Profit after tax for the quarter is INR 16.54 crores.
  • Earnings per equity share (of 210 each) are INR 4.91 (basic) and INR 4.67 (diluted).
  • The results have been reviewed by the Audit Committee and approved by the Board of Directors.
  • The financial results have been prepared in accordance with the Companies (Indian Accounting Standards) Rules, 2015.

item.title: [ORISSAMINE] Manish Raj Gupta Appointed as Non-Executive Chairman of Orissa Minerals Development Company Ltd
item.description:
Orissa Minerals Development Company Ltd has appointed Manish Raj Gupta as its Non-Executive Chairman. Gupta, who is currently the CMD (additional charge) at Rashtriya Ispat Nigam Limited (RINL), will replace AK Saxena. Gupta is a seasoned professional with over three decades of experience in the steel industry. He has served in various roles at Steel Authority of India Limited (SAIL) and RINL, demonstrating strong leadership and technical expertise. Gupta's appointment is in compliance with the Companies Act, 2013 and SEBI (Listing Obligations and Disclosure Requirements) Regulations, 2015.

  • Manish Raj Gupta appointed as Non-Executive Chairman of Orissa Minerals Development Company Ltd
  • Gupta replaces AK Saxena as Chairman
  • Gupta is a seasoned professional with over three decades of experience in the steel industry
  • Appointment is in compliance with the Companies Act, 2013 and SEBI (Listing Obligations and Disclosure Requirements) Regulations, 2015
  • Gupta is currently the CMD (additional charge) at Rashtriya Ispat Nigam Limited (RINL)

item.title: [RCL] Radhagobind Commercial Ltd Holds 3rd COC Meeting on 05-02-2026: Discusses CIRP Progress, Forensic Auditors Appointment, and More
item.description:
Radhagobind Commercial Ltd (formerly Tejmangal Commercial Company Limited) held its 3rd Committee of Creditors (COC) meeting on 05-02-2026. The meeting, chaired by the Interim Resolution Professional (IRP) Mr. Najeeb TP, discussed the progress on the Corporate Insolvency Resolution Process (CIRP), appointment of Forensic Auditors, reconstitution of the CoC, status issuance of Form G, Income Tax appeal, and more. The meeting also ratified CIRP Cost incurred by the IRP and contributed by the Applicants. The company's registered and corporate offices are in Kolkata and Ernakulam, respectively.

  • Radhagobind Commercial Ltd held its 3rd COC meeting on 05-02-2026.
  • The meeting was chaired by the Interim Resolution Professional (IRP) Mr. Najeeb TP.
  • The progress on the Corporate Insolvency Resolution Process (CIRP) and various related matters were discussed.
  • The appointment of Forensic Auditors and reconstitution of the CoC were updated.
  • The meeting ratified CIRP Cost incurred by the IRP and contributed by the Applicants.

item.title: [LLOYDSME] Lloyds Metals and Energy Ltd: No Deviation from Objects in Q4 2025 Monitoring Agency Report
item.description:
Lloyds Metals and Energy Ltd, a manufacturing and mining company, has received a clean chit from India Ratings & Research Private Limited for the quarter ended 31st December, 2025. The Monitoring Agency Report, issued pursuant to Regulation 162A(2) of the SEBI ICDR Regulations, states that there has been no deviation from the objects as per the Management undertaking and the Statutory Auditor Certificate. The report also mentions that all Government/Statutory approvals related to the object(s) have been obtained and all arrangements pertaining to technical assistance/collaboration are in operation.

  • No deviation from the objects as per the Management undertaking and the Statutory Auditor Certificate
  • All Government/Statutory approvals related to the object(s) have been obtained
  • All arrangements pertaining to technical assistance/collaboration are in operation
  • No major deviations observed over the earlier monitoring agency reports

item.title: [SKFINDUS] SKF India (Industrial) Ltd Reports Q3 and Nine Month Results for 2025, Announces New Factory and Personnel Changes
item.description:
SKF India (Industrial) Ltd has reported its unaudited financial results for the third quarter and nine months ended December 31, 2025. The Board approved the results, which were prepared in accordance with Ind AS 34 and other accounting principles generally accepted in India. The company announced the resignation of Mr. Ranjan Kumar as Company Secretary and Compliance Officer, and the appointment of Ms. Poorva Bang and Ms. Deeksha Hapawat as Company Secretary, Compliance Officer, and Interim Head of Legal, Secretarial, and Corporate Affairs, respectively. Additionally, the Board approved the setting up of a new factory in Pune, Maharashtra.

  • SKF India (Industrial) Ltd reported Q3 and nine-month results for 2025.
  • The company's financial results were prepared in accordance with Ind AS 34 and other accounting principles generally accepted in India.
  • Mr. Ranjan Kumar resigned as Company Secretary and Compliance Officer, while Ms. Poorva Bang and Ms. Deeksha Hapawat were appointed as Company Secretary, Compliance Officer, and Interim Head of Legal, Secretarial, and Corporate Affairs.
  • The Board approved the setting up of a new factory in Pune, Maharashtra.

item.title: [IREDA] Indian Renewable Energy Development Agency Ltd to Raise 32,994 Crore Through QIP
item.description:
The Indian Renewable Energy Development Agency Ltd has announced the closure of its trading window in accordance with the SEBI LODR Regulations. The Board of Directors will meet on February 06, 2026, to consider and approve the raising of funds through the issuance of equity shares by way of a qualified institutions placement (QIP) for an amount aggregating up to 32,994 Crore. The decision is subject to approval from the shareholders of the Company and any necessary governmental/regulatory/statutory authorities. A postal ballot will be convened to seek approval from the shareholders. The trading window will remain closed 48 hours after the conclusion of the board meeting.

  • Indian Renewable Energy Development Agency Ltd to raise 32,994 Crore through QIP
  • Trading window closed till 48 hours after the board meeting
  • Funds to be raised through equity shares by way of a QIP
  • Approval sought from shareholders and necessary authorities
